page.title: 08Computing 1981 to 1985
page.content: In the last four years computing has caught on at an amazing rate, mainly thanks to{Sir Clive Sinclair.}Sinclair brought out the{ZX80 in 1981}and the {ZX81 in 1982.}The{ZX Spectrum}followed in{1983}and the{QL in 1984.}Before this, costly computers were really just for experts. Then ordinary people started to become interseted in them, mainly for playing games. The early computer owners were handy with a soldering iron and often were electricians or electronics experts themselves. When I first got my Spectrum I just played games, and then tried to write simple programs in {BASIC.}It was at the school computer club that I first encountered{LOGO crowded around an{Apple II}learning with our teacher. Now we have {Spectrums, Beebs}and the{Apple}all running{LOGO.}Happy Beacon Turtlers!
